content:
• Monday, October 17, 2011
  • REGN

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:REGN) announces a private placement offering $400M of...

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:REGN) announces a private placement offering $400M of convertible senior notes due in 2016. Shares -4.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • IBM

    In its Q3 earnings conference call, IBM noted that compared to last year, its services backlog...

    In its Q3 earnings conference call, IBM noted that compared to last year, its services backlog rose $2B to $137B, though this quarter it expects "improved growth rates out of the backlog"; free cash flow of $7.6B was flat Y/Y. Management expects a "very similar" Q4 - which could be trouble with some observers thinking that's too rosy amid challenges in Systems & Technology. Shares now -3.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • CWTR

    Apparel retailer Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) falls 10.6% after guiding for Q3 revenue of...

    Apparel retailer Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) falls 10.6% after guiding for Q3 revenue of $180M-$190M and EPS of -$.30 to $-$.36, compared with a consensus of $190M and -$0.28; the weakness is blamed on a 17%-21% Y/Y decline in same-store sales. Coldwater's Q4 EPS guidance is better than Street expectations, but investors appear skeptical.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • SLF

    Sun Life (SLF -10%), Canada's 3rd largest insurer, plunged after warning weak markets would...

    Sun Life (SLF -10%), Canada's 3rd largest insurer, plunged after warning weak markets would cause a $621M Q3 loss, and took other Canadian insurers - including Manulife MFC -5.6% - with it. The companies are getting hit by a lethal combination of weak equity markets and nearly invisible bond yields.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • NAVB

    Neoprobe (NEOP -10.2%) fell sharply in afternoon trading on rumors an application for its...

    Neoprobe (NEOP -10.2%) fell sharply in afternoon trading on rumors an application for its Lymphoseek cancer-detection drug was rejected. However, shares are up 5.8% AH after a spokesperson says Neoprobe isn't aware of any news about its application, which the FDA is expected to decide upon by Oct. 24.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • SKX

    Shares of Skechers (NYSE:SKX) move 4.4% lower in after-hours trading after Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX)...

    Shares of Skechers (NYSE:SKX) move 4.4% lower in after-hours trading after Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) slashes its estimate for Q3 revenue. Other shoe-sellers moving lower AH: SHOO -2.3%, DECK -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) resume trading following its guidance cut, and are now down 35%.

    Shares of Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) resume trading following its guidance cut, and are now down 35%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • NR

    Oil & gas equipment supplier Newpark Resources (NYSE:NR) gains 1.6% AH after announcing...

    Oil & gas equipment supplier Newpark Resources (NYSE:NR) gains 1.6% AH after announcing preliminary Q3 results in tandem with the news that its CFO will be leaving at the end of the month. Newpark expects Q3 revenue of $260M and EPS of $0.22-$0.23, well above a consensus of $237.2M and $0.17.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • AAL

    American Airlines says it recessed negotiations with its pilots union today after making...

    American Airlines says it recessed negotiations with its pilots union today after making "significant progress" toward a contract that would end more than five years of talks. Shares of parent AMR (AMR -6.2%) plunged after failure to reach an expected settlement during the weekend; in any case, it's not clear if a deal can save the airline, as bankruptcy fears linger.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • STRI

    STR Holdings (NYSE:STRI) lowers Q3 guidance, now seeing its EPS at $0.01 - $0.02, significantly...

    STR Holdings (NYSE:STRI) lowers Q3 guidance, now seeing its EPS at $0.01 - $0.02, significantly below its earlier forcast of $0.12 - $0.16. Revenues however, are expected to be in line with Street estimates. Additionally, due to the lack of clarity regarding global demand for solar products during the fourth quarter, the company is withdrawing its previous FY11 guidance. Shares -13.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • VMW

    More on VMWare's (NYSE:VMW) Q3 results: Q3 free cash flow was $494M (+108% Y/Y), well above net...

    More on VMWare's (NYSE:VMW) Q3 results: Q3 free cash flow was $494M (+108% Y/Y), well above net income of $178M. Free cash flow growth was driven in part by unearned revenue of $152.8M (+61% Q/Q). Q4 revenue is expected to be in a range of $1.03-$1.06B, compared with a $1.03B consensus. VMW -2.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • SFSF

    SuccessFactors (NYSE:SFSF) raises its Q3 revenue forecast to between $93M-$95M from $83M-$84M,...

    SuccessFactors (NYSE:SFSF) raises its Q3 revenue forecast to between $93M-$95M from $83M-$84M, above Street estimates of of $83.62M. Shares +9.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • SSW

    Container-ship owner Seaspan (SSW +2%) finishes the day in positive territory after an article...

    Container-ship owner Seaspan (SSW +2%) finishes the day in positive territory after an article in Barron's over the weekend points out the company has a growing fleet and long-term lease contracts from shipping lines - including deals for ships that have yet to be delivered. Fears of a global slowdown have weighed on its share price, but its 5.8% current yield could keep spark investors attention.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q3 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $941.8M (+32% Y/Y) beats by...

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q3 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $941.8M (+32% Y/Y) beats by $12.4M. VMW -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA -6.8%) is the Dow's leading loser after shares are downgraded to Underperform from...

    Alcoa (AA -6.8%) is the Dow's leading loser after shares are downgraded to Underperform from Market Perform at First Global, citing a higher-than-expected drop in metal prices and a stronger dollar.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR +2.2%) holds on to gains late in the day after its Q3 loss per share...

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR +2.2%) holds on to gains late in the day after its Q3 loss per share came in better than consensus. The company reported revenue of $138M, easily topping Street estimates for $124M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • GME

    Jim Chanos' latest short suggestion: GameStop (GME -3.2%), which he sees as basically an analog...

    Jim Chanos' latest short suggestion: GameStop (GME -3.2%), which he sees as basically an analog business in an era of digital distribution, and thus vulnerable to Blockbuster-style obsolescence. “It's cheap; boy is it cheap," Chanos cracks. “And boy is it in a bad business. This one will appear cheap all the way down." His barbs have moved several stocks today: I, II.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • ESI-OLD

    For-profit education firms slide after Jim Chanos labels them "a national shame," passing out...

    For-profit education firms slide after Jim Chanos labels them "a national shame," passing out worthless degrees and tons of debt. "I cant think of a more predatory business," he says, singling out ITT Educational Services (ESI-OLD -4.6%) as a particularly egregious offender. Other education names sink: APOL -3.5%, CECO -7%, DV -4%, WPO -2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 7 Comments
  • IPG

    With fears of a global economic slowdown lingering, Wedbush comes out in defense of its bullish...

    With fears of a global economic slowdown lingering, Wedbush comes out in defense of its bullish view on advertising agencies, reiterating its Outperform ratings on Interpublic Group (IPG -6.4%) and WPP Group (WPPGY -2.5%). The firm says its current forecast calls for an increase in global media and marketing spending growth in 2012, and notes that both firms are less vulnerable to an economic slowdown due to their worldwide exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • GCI

    Gannett's (GCI -7.9%) new CEO, Gracia Martore, remains upbeat in a CC after the company issued a...

    Gannett's (GCI -7.9%) new CEO, Gracia Martore, remains upbeat in a CC after the company issued a less-than-stellar Q3 report, pointing to a 10% increase in digital revenue - led by strong growth with CareerBuilder - as a highlight. She warns Q4 broadcasting revenue is trending to be down in the low teens, attributing the decline to a tough Y/Y comparable for its political advertising.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • SNDA

    Several Chinese Internet stocks are up on a down day after Shanda's (SNDA +16.9%) chairman...

    Several Chinese Internet stocks are up on a down day after Shanda's (SNDA +16.9%) chairman offers to take the company private, raising hopes of similar deals for other firms. GA +3.8%. OTCPK:WZENY +10.4%. NTES +1%. CYOU +0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • GMCR

    While Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.7%) tumbles thanks to David Einhorn's words, Sprint (S...

    While Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.7%) tumbles thanks to David Einhorn's words, Sprint (S +0.2%) is outperforming because of them. The carrier is extending last week's rally after Einhorn, whose firm owns 56M shares, says he's still bullish, and thinks Sprint can raise capital without diluting shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHDN

    Brean Murray weighs in on Churchill Downs (CHDN -2.9%) as part of its Q3 earnings preview of the...

    Brean Murray weighs in on Churchill Downs (CHDN -2.9%) as part of its Q3 earnings preview of the gaming sector, maintaining a Buy rating on shares with a lofty $65 price target. Analysts with the firm raise their estimate for EPS to $2.43 from $2.38, saying the Calder casino and Breeder's Cup will drive revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • WDC

    A number of storage manufacturers and chipmakers are off sharply on news of Western Digital's...

    A number of storage manufacturers and chipmakers are off sharply on news of Western Digital's (WDC -7.4%) Thai troubles, as investors worry the hard drive giant's manufacturing problems will have major ripple effects. NTAP -4%. OCZ -5.7%. STEC -4.1%. QTM-OLD -5.4%. MRVL -5.4%. LSI-OLD -5.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -8.1%) gets hit after data from IMS Health shows flat sales in...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -8.1%) gets hit after data from IMS Health shows flat sales in September and the first week of October for the company's hepatitis C drug Incivek.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC -7.1%) is down after announcing it was extending the suspension of its...

    Western Digital (WDC -7.1%) is down after announcing it was extending the suspension of its Thailand operations due to the recent floods. Additionally, the company says the closure is significantly affecting the chip maker's overall operations and constraining its ability to meet Q2 customer demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • SYNT

    Syntel (SYNT -2.9%) trades lower after releasing its preliminary Q3 and FY11 sales numbers....

    Syntel (SYNT -2.9%) trades lower after releasing its preliminary Q3 and FY11 sales numbers. Despite beating current estimates, it says FY11 EPS will come in below expectations due to a one-time, non-recurring charge to earnings to resolve arbitration claims with a former client.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • HTZ

    Shares of Hertz Global (NYSE:HTZ) trade 4.2% lower on the same day a report hits the internet...

    Shares of Hertz Global (NYSE:HTZ) trade 4.2% lower on the same day a report hits the internet saying the company is displaying increased "urgency" in its plan to sell its deep-discount Advantage car rental business.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -6%) continues moving lower after Carl Icahn says the one-time...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -6%) continues moving lower after Carl Icahn says the one-time smartphone leader isn't on his radar, and isn't his type of target. RIM, which has seen a flurry of buyout speculation, could also be selling off on a belief the company's attempts to make amends for recent outages are inadequate.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.1%) remains off sharply after David Einhorn elaborates on his...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.1%) remains off sharply after David Einhorn elaborates on his bearish stance. Einhorn is critical of Green Mountain's accounting work; considers its K-Cups to be too expensive; and thinks the company's deal with SBUX will prove less lucrative than some expect. Coffee Holding Co. (JVA -6.5%) is also selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • RLD

    RealD (RLD -8.5%) plunges following IMAX's deal to license patents from Eastman Kodak (EK +5.7%)...

    RealD (RLD -8.5%) plunges following IMAX's deal to license patents from Eastman Kodak (EK +5.7%) related to laser projection systems, which are an alternative to RealD's 3D projection systems. BTIG's Richard Greenfield believes Kodak offers a superior solution for 3D films, given its much higher light output.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • GLBR

    Despite an earlier announcement that it would be boosting its buyback program, shares of FXCM...

    Despite an earlier announcement that it would be boosting its buyback program, shares of FXCM continue their descent. The stock has given back another 3.3% today, on top of a 12% hit on Friday after the company reported disappointing monthly metrics.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • C

    Going through Citi's (C -1.6%) numbers and listening to the conference call, J.T. Smith...

    Going through Citi's (C -1.6%) numbers and listening to the conference call, J.T. Smith scratches his head. RE loans 30-89 days late rose from 4.09% to 4.34%, and CEO Pandit says loan modifications are starting to redefault and he expects them to get worse. Yet the company released $1.4B in loss reserves this quarter (boosting income by 58%)?

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • HAL

    Citigroup comments on Halliburton's (HAL -7.2%) Q3 report, saying the results "demonstrate that...

    Citigroup comments on Halliburton's (HAL -7.2%) Q3 report, saying the results "demonstrate that North America remains a robust market and international is on track for a gradual recovery." The firm keeps a Buy rating in place, and sees today's downward swing in share price as an overreaction to management's statements that drilling in the dry gas basins will slow and international markets are competitive.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • SCHW

    The unintended consequences of the Fed's ZIRP claims a victim in Charles Schwab (SCHW -3.7%),...

    The unintended consequences of the Fed's ZIRP claims a victim in Charles Schwab (SCHW -3.7%), whose business is healthy but is getting slammed as it waives fees to clients so their money market funds don't see a negative return. The firm waived $160M in fees in Q3, cutting its net income to $220M. (earnings)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • FDO

    Family Dollar Stores (FDO +1.7%) trades higher after Barclays ups the shares to overweight,...

    Family Dollar Stores (FDO +1.7%) trades higher after Barclays ups the shares to overweight, saying recent meetings with the company leave it comfortable with the retailer's ability to achieve strong and stable sales and earnings growth over the next few quarters.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • IPG

    Interpublic Group (IPG -6.4%) gets hit after Deutsche cuts the stock to hold, saying that hopes...

    Interpublic Group (IPG -6.4%) gets hit after Deutsche cuts the stock to hold, saying that hopes for a turnaround are likely to be delayed by potential softness in the global ad market and revenue fallout from recent client losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • ITRI

    Smart-meter maker Itron (ITRI +0.6%) bucks a weak tape on positive comments in Barron's over the...

    Smart-meter maker Itron (ITRI +0.6%) bucks a weak tape on positive comments in Barron's over the weekend. The article says its shares have been pummeled recently due to fears about growth, but the stock could rebound to $45 as the company wins new contracts in the U.S. and overseas.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • C

    Citigroup (C -0.7%) gives up big early gains on the back of its earnings beat. The stock is a...

    Citigroup (C -0.7%) gives up big early gains on the back of its earnings beat. The stock is a victim of the faltering market around it as well as the realization that its "beat" may have had more to do with accounting maneuvers than strong operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +0.8%) gain after the company follows the path of Lowe's (LOW +1.4%) in...

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +0.8%) gain after the company follows the path of Lowe's (LOW +1.4%) in paring costs with its own (smaller) plan of shuttering a Louisiana call center and eliminating 400 jobs over the next few months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • HIBB

    Sterne Agee downgrades several footwear and apparel companies this morning, citing a number of...

    Sterne Agee downgrades several footwear and apparel companies this morning, citing a number of issues including poor margin improvement and increasing inventory concerns. the firm cuts: Hibbett (HIBB -2.8%), Kenneth Cole (KCP -1.6%), Shoe Carnival (SCVL -2.3%) and Wolverine World Wide (WWW -2.7%) to neutral, and Columbia Sportswear (COLM -3.9%), Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS -1.5%) and K-Swiss (KSWS -6.4%) to underperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.7%) sells off after David Einhorn says he's bearish on the...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.7%) sells off after David Einhorn says he's bearish on the single-serve coffee kingpin at an investing conference. "I have a position," Einhorn adds. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 6 Comments
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX -8%) and James River Coal (JRCC -4.6%) are both weak this morning after Brean...

    Patriot Coal (PCX -8%) and James River Coal (JRCC -4.6%) are both weak this morning after Brean Murray initiates lackluster coverage on the Appalachian coal miners with a hold (I, II). The firm cites concerns over rising costs for producers in the region that need to be addressed before it can really get bullish.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • GLBR

    Forex broker FXCM is increasing the size of its stock repurchase program to $50M, from a prior...

    Forex broker FXCM is increasing the size of its stock repurchase program to $50M, from a prior $30M. Nonetheless, shares are still down 4.8%, adding to the losses incurred on Friday following a weak monthly metrics report.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • VTRO

    Microcap digital media firm Vertro (VTRO +22%) pops after agreeing to be acquired by its peer...

    Microcap digital media firm Vertro (VTRO +22%) pops after agreeing to be acquired by its peer Inuvo (INUV -14%) in an all cash deal for around $20M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • AAL

    AMR (AMR -6%) fell sharply around 10:50, but has since recouped some of its losses. Fresh...

    AMR (AMR -6%) fell sharply around 10:50, but has since recouped some of its losses. Fresh bankruptcy rumors appear to be the culprit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • PRX

    Par Pharmaceutical (PRX -2.7%) trades lower after saying late Friday that it's challenging a...

    Par Pharmaceutical (PRX -2.7%) trades lower after saying late Friday that it's challenging a federal rule that it claims infringes on its first-amendment right to promote its anorexia treatment Megace ES. Doctors feel the drug could benefit a variety of patients outside the FDA approved AIDS-only spectrum, but the company says the FDA is blocking it from discussing treatment options.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • VMC

    Construction products maker Vulcan Materials (VMC -3.8%) trades lower after slashing its...

    Construction products maker Vulcan Materials (VMC -3.8%) trades lower after slashing its quarterly dividend to just $0.01/share, from a prior $0.25/share, and replacing a credit facility due to expire in November with a new 5-year, $500M facility. Moody's downgraded Vulcan's debt rating last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • ITG

    Shares of Investment Technology Group (ITG +1.2%) gain after the company approves the buyback of...

    Shares of Investment Technology Group (ITG +1.2%) gain after the company approves the buyback of an additional 4M shares on top of its existing repurchasement program. The company also issues Q3 guidance, saying it sees EPS in range of $0.23-$0.25 - led by higher global trading volumes and cost management initiatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • SQNM

    Shares of Sequenom (SQNM +11.1%) pop after the company announces the launch of its MaterniT21...

    Shares of Sequenom (SQNM +11.1%) pop after the company announces the launch of its MaterniT21 noninvasive prematernal test for Down syndrome. The test is now available in 20 metropolitan cities for expectant women.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +2%) gains after saying it's resubmitted a new drug application for its Qnexa...

    Vivus (VVUS +2%) gains after saying it's resubmitted a new drug application for its Qnexa obesity drug to the FDA. The application had been rejected in September due to questions surrounding its filing strategy and minor labeling issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • CREE

    Morgan Stanley is declaring LED chipmaker Cree (CREE -7%) a tactical sell, believing shares will...

    Morgan Stanley is declaring LED chipmaker Cree (CREE -7%) a tactical sell, believing shares will sell off following tomorrow's FQ1 report due to weak guidance. Meanwhile, Canaccord is downgrading LED equipment maker Veeco (VECO -7.3%) to Sell. LED equipment maker Aixtron (AIXG -6.7%) and wafer maker Rubicon (RBCN -9.4%) are also off sharply.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • SCHW

    Charles Schwab (SCHW -2.7%) sells off after reporting Q3 revenue of $1.18B (+11% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Charles Schwab (SCHW -2.7%) sells off after reporting Q3 revenue of $1.18B (+11% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.18, missing Street forecasts by $10M and $0.01. Schwab ended the quarter with 8.5M brokerage accounts (+370K Q/Q), 2.4M advisory accounts, 769K banking accounts, and client assets of 1.58T (-5% Q/Q). (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • GCI

    Gannett's (GCI -5.4%) gloomy Q3 report also hits the shares of other print media companies, as a...

    Gannett's (GCI -5.4%) gloomy Q3 report also hits the shares of other print media companies, as a triple threat of a slow economy, falling circulation, and pressured advertising revenue lingers over the sector. Falling in sympathy: NYT -3.3%, MNI -2.4%, NWSA -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • GCI

    Shares of Gannett (NYSE:GCI), up in premarket trading, fall off 5.4% after its Q3 earnings miss...

    Shares of Gannett (NYSE:GCI), up in premarket trading, fall off 5.4% after its Q3 earnings miss is digested by investors. The company reports national advertising was 15% lower in the quarter and classified advertising was hit with a 9.4% drop.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI +3.1%) recoups some of the big losses incurred on Friday after Chipworks...

    OmniVision (OVTI +3.1%) recoups some of the big losses incurred on Friday after Chipworks confirmed the loss of iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) image sensor share to SNE. Multiple analysts are reaffirming bullish ratings even as they lower their PTs (I, II, III), citing a low P/E and expectations of strong overall Apple-related shipments.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +5.3%) and Williams (WMB +4%) open higher after  Kinder Morgan...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +5.3%) and Williams (WMB +4%) open higher after  Kinder Morgan (KMI +7.2%) and El Paso's (EP +23.8%) merger announcement boosts hopes of further consolidation among U.S. natural gas firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • JOY

    Mining equipment maker Joy Global (JOYG) gains 1.2% premarket after Jefferies upgrades shares to...

    Mining equipment maker Joy Global (JOYG) gains 1.2% premarket after Jefferies upgrades shares to Buy, and lifts its PT to $100. Jefferies cites a lower valuation and strong revenue outlook as reasons for its upgrade, and believes Joy Global "will be a key beneficiary of the re-capitalization of the mining sector."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) halts copper and gold production at its giant Grasberg mine in...

    Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) halts copper and gold production at its giant Grasberg mine in Indonesia because of security fears and worker blockades, in the worst supply disruption since a strike began a month ago. FCX also faces labor problems in Peru at its Cerro Verde mine, which supplies ~2% of world output. London copper +0.8%. FCX -1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANDS

    Premarket gainers: ANDS +253%. EP +28%. BEXP +20%. YRCW +14%. EK +12%. KOG +7%. KMI +5%. WMB...

    Premarket gainers: ANDS +253%. EP +28%. BEXP +20%. YRCW +14%. EK +12%. KOG +7%. KMI +5%. WMB +5%. APC +4%. BP +3%. S +3%.
    Losers: NBG -7%. EPB -5%. WFC -5%. ALU -4%. DB -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • NAV

    Goldman Sachs downgrades Navistar (NYSE:NAV) to Sell with a $38 price target due to its exposure...

    Goldman Sachs downgrades Navistar (NYSE:NAV) to Sell with a $38 price target due to its exposure to government austerity measures. The firm expects consensus 2012-2013 estimates to be reduced by 30% driven by a steeper downturn in U.S. military vehicle demand and the resultant margin pressure. NAV -3.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) stays on a growth track, announcing plans to expand its operations in the...

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) stays on a growth track, announcing plans to expand its operations in the U.K. with 35 new locations over the next six years. Management of the firm's UK division increased its equity stake in the business with a managed buyout valued at £25M ($39.5M), helping free them up to pursue the new growth drive. Shares -0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ) drops 8.2% premarket after warning its Q3 gross margin will be in a...

    Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ) drops 8.2% premarket after warning its Q3 gross margin will be in a range of just 2-5%, compared with prior guidance of 9-12%, due to the ugly pricing environment for solar products. The company is reiterating its module unit shipment forecast of 350MW-360MW.
